studyArms.name: Nivolumab Arm
studyArms.description: Nivolumab 240 mg administered as a 30-minute IV infusion every 2 weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

studyArms.name: Sorafenib Arm
studyArms.description: Sorafenib 400 mg administered orally twice a day (BID) until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

studyCohorts.name: HCV-HCC
studyCohorts.characteristic: Active or resolved HCV infection as evidenced by detectable HCV RNA or antibody

studyCohorts.name: HBV-HCC
studyCohorts.characteristic: Resolved or Chronic HBV infection with HBV DNA < 100 IU/mL and on antiviral therapy

studyCohorts.name: Non-viral HCC
studyCohorts.characteristic: HCC with no history of hepatitis virus infection

studyDesign.name: Study Design
stratificationFactors: Vascular invasion and/or extrahepatic spread (present vs. absent)
Vascular invasion and/or extrahepatic spread (present vs. absent)

arms.name: Nivolumab Arm
arms.description: Nivolumab 240 mg administered as a 30-minute IV infusion every 2 weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

arms.name: Sorafenib Arm
arms.description: Sorafenib 400 mg administered orally twice a day (BID) until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

cohorts.name: HCV-HCC
cohorts.characteristic: Active or resolved HCV infection as evidenced by detectable HCV RNA or antibody

cohorts.name: HBV-HCC
cohorts.characteristic: Resolved or Chronic HBV infection with HBV DNA < 100 IU/mL and on antiviral therapy

cohorts.name: Non-viral HCC
cohorts.characteristic: HCC with no history of hepatitis virus infection

epochs.name: Screening
epochs.description: Begins with signing of ICF; includes eligibility assessment and tumor tissue submission.

epochs.name: Treatment Phase
epochs.description: Begins with randomization; subjects receive either Nivolumab or Sorafenib until progression or toxicity.

epochs.name: Follow-up Phase
epochs.description: Includes two safety visits (35 and 80 days post-last dose) and survival follow-up every 3 months.
